books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment that comes with it.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: A novel set in the Deep South and focused on themes of racial injustice and moral growth.
A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation narrated by the protagonist Holden Caulfield.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.description: A philosophical book that tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy on a journey to discover his personal legend.

authors.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald

authors.biography: An American novelist known for 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

authors.biography: An English novelist known for her social commentary.
